<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;7dbfdc18.1503">   <title>Looking for HERA partners: Identity and National Theatre </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;7dbfdc18.1503</link>   <description> Looking for HERA partners.<br><br>TITLE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT: Identity and National Theatre<br><br>SHORT DESCRIPTION:<br>The aim of the project is to investigate the beginnings, growth and modifications of the idea of a national theatre, the key concepts of national theatre from the foundation of first national theatres till today, and changes in the concept \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd with regard to both the time within a particular national community, and the space in parallel view of different national communities. The objective is to analyse what constituted the idea of a national theatre, how it functioned throughout the 20th century and how it [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T12:46:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Martina Petranovic</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;7dbfdc18.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;61b044ff.1503">   <title>Keywords and Dictionaries as Repositories of the Past </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;61b044ff.1503</link>   <description> Marion Loeffler marion.loeffler@wales.ac.uk Wales/UK<br><br>Looking for partners in: Finland, Iceland, The Netherlands, Germany, France, Sweden, Poland, Ireland, Norway, Czech Republic, Italy, Denmark<br><br>Keywords and Dictionaries as Repositories of the Past from Enlightenment to National Dictionary<br><br>Concepts such as 'people', 'nation', 'revolution', 'republic' and 'democracy'; their changing meanings and their various forms in the languages of Europe have enabled communication about and shaped the way we perceive and thus use the past since the Enlightenment. This project seeks to explore the changing meanings of such key terms in political literature in the 18th and 19th centuries, and their changing codification in [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:01:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Marion Loeffler</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;61b044ff.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;e2c5313c.1503">   <title>Re: IMUSIAH. Improve the Uses of the Incomplete Architectural Heritage </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;e2c5313c.1503</link>   <description> Dear Maria Luisa,<br><br>We would very interesting in contributing to IMUSIAH proposal to HERA call with our research on Classic Architectural Metrology (Modulation and Sizing).<br>Please see these papers as examples of this research line:<br><br>http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00004-012-0125-5#page-1<br><br>http://varjournal.es/doc/varj04_009_12.pdf<br><br>Looking forward to your news,<br>Marta<br><br>Dr Marta Roldan-Medina<br>EU &amp; International RTD Projects Promoter<br>Universidad de Castilla-La Mancha (UCLM)<br>ITQUIMA Avda Camilo Jose Cela s/n<br>13071 Ciudad Real SPAIN<br>e-mail marta.roldan@uclm.es&lt;mailto:marta.roldan@uclm.es&gt;<br>Phone +34 680222495 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:40:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MARTA ROLDAN MEDINA</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;e2c5313c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;23c65fba.1503">   <title>Europe and the Italian Renaissance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;23c65fba.1503</link>   <description> Message from Helen Fulton, University of Bristol, UK<br>helen.fulton@bristol.ac.uk<br><br>Looking for HERA partners from any country EXCEPT UK and Italy.<br><br>Title of Project: Europe and the Italian Renaissance: Reception and Legacy 1350\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd1800.<br>The aim of the project is to investigate the reception of the Italian Renaissance in the pre-modern centuries, focusing on European countries beyond Italy. This is a multi-disciplinary project with a number of strands. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T18:43:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Helen Fulton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;23c65fba.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee1a8940.1503">   <title>LOOKING FOR PARTNERS ABOUT THE TOPIC: EUROPEAN DIGITIZED CULTURAL HERITAGE AND ORPHAN WORKS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee1a8940.1503</link>   <description> I am Rosario Arquero Avil\ufffd\ufffds (full professor at the School of Librarian and Information Sciences of the Complutense University in Madrid (UCM), Spain.<br><br>Professor L. Fernando Ramos Sim\ufffd\ufffdn and me coordinate the research group Publidoc-UCM.<br><br>I looking for partners about the topics: European digitized cultural heritage; orphan works; public domain.<br><br>Short Description of Subject/topic of proposed project: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T18:39:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>ROSARIO ARQUERO AVIL\ufffd\ufffdS - COMPLUTENSE UNIVERSITY - SPAIN</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee1a8940.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;798a7c2a.1503">   <title>Bogtrotters wanted... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;798a7c2a.1503</link>   <description> We are looking for project partners for the following proposal. Please get in touch (email below) if interested. Thanks!<br><br>Peatlands feature transnationally in cultural productions: the evocative power of prehistoric ‘bog bodies’, discovered across Northern Europe, for example, transcends cultural differences.<br><br>Peatlands are remarkable archaeological resources, preserving organic remains that do not survive on dry land sites. Drainage, agriculture and processes such as climate change threaten the many ecosystem services that peatlands provide including carbon sequestration and water storage. Europe thus faces a range of problems associated with the impacts of climate change, thus, identifying the multiple role(s) of the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T10:07:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gearey, Benjamin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;798a7c2a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee614587.1503">   <title>IMUSIAH. Improve the Uses of the Incomplete Architectural Heritage </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee614587.1503</link>   <description> As a multidisciplinary team in Department of Architecture in Palermo University, we are looking for non-Italian partners interested in Architectural Heritage. We propose the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdincompleteness\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (both of material and immaterial aspects) as a key to face the problem of the current uses of Architectural heritage.<br>We are going to pose some research questions, as: What role does the Architectural Heritage play in a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdreflective society\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd? Is it determining in identity construction at individual and collective levels? Which intertwined social, economical and cultural factors do influence the use of the Architectural Heritage? What are the consequences of using the Architectural Heritage, [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:16:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Maria Luisa German\ufffd\ufffd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ee614587.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;17f778c3.1503">   <title>Euromonsters! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;17f778c3.1503</link>   <description> We are interested in potential principle investigators (NOT resident in<br>the UK or Portugal) interested in participating in a project<br>investigating the occurrence and representation of sea monsters in<br>historical European sources Our aim is get as wide as geographic and<br>linguistic coverage within Europe as possible so collaborators from<br>Scandinavia, the Baltic and the Mediterranean are especially welcome. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T12:26:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Paxton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;17f778c3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2de32f8c.1503">   <title>search for no-Italian partners </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2de32f8c.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues, I am Renata De Lorenzo professor of History at the University of Naples Federico II (Italy). We are applying to the HERA call "Uses of the Past" with a project proposal on "explosions all over the Europe".Our research idea is to study European explosions in a wide sense (17th-20th centuries). Mainly events which happened at the same time in different regions of Europe. With the word "explosion" we refer to every kind of explosive episodes in the natural, cultural and social history. If You wish more details about our sources and proposal ideas, please, do write to this [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:50:49+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>C. G.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2de32f8c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;29e387c.1503">   <title>non-Italian parteners </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;29e387c.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>I am Renata De Lorenzo professor of History at the University of Naples Federico II (Italy). We are applying to the HERA call &quot;Uses of the Past&quot; with a project proposal on &quot;explosions all over the Europe&quot;. Our research idea is that to study European explosions in a wide sense (17th-20th centuries), mainly events which happened at the same time in different regions of Europe. With the word &quot;explosion&quot; we refer to explosive episodes in the natural, cultural and social history.<br>If You wish more details about our sources and proposal ideas, please, do write to this address: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:46:38+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>C. G.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;29e387c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;9e53a1cf.1503">   <title>Serch for Research Collaboration </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;9e53a1cf.1503</link>   <description> Humanities in the European Research Area// Joint Research Programme \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdUses of the Past\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Polish Research Team \ufffd\ufffd\ufffduses of the past\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd first call collaboration proposal<br><br>FROM GENEAOLOGY TO GENERATIVITY (GTG)<br>Values transmission between generations in European societies<br><br>In our research project we are interested in discovering the possibilities of intergenerational values transmission between generations in European societies. Our leading assumption is that values, conditioned by past experience, could play the meaningful function as the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdvehicle\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of bridging the past time with the future time dimension and that this process happens on three interconnected levels: personal, culture and human condition integrity. People [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:17:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Urszula Tokarska</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;9e53a1cf.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;6bea044e.1503">   <title>HERA UP Partners Searching </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;6bea044e.1503</link>   <description> Humanities in the European Research Area// Joint Research Programme \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdUses of the Past\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Polish Research Team \ufffd\ufffd\ufffduses of the past\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd first call collaboration proposal<br><br>FROM GENEAOLOGY TO GENERATIVITY (GTG)<br>Values transmission between generations in European societies<br><br>In our research project we are interested in discovering the possibilities of intergenerational values transmission between generations in European societies. Our leading assumption is that values, conditioned by past experience, could play the meaningful function as the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdvehicle\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of bridging the past time with the future time dimension and that this process happens on three interconnected levels: personal, culture and human condition integrity. People [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:29:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Urszula Tokarska</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;6bea044e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3e899928.1503">   <title>Climate history of the early modern world </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3e899928.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I am a researcher based in Heidelberg, Germany and have just submitted my<br>PhD. I am looking for researchers (including a principal Investigator) who<br>would be interested in participating in a project on the envoronmental and<br>climatic history of the early modern world. I myself am working on early<br>modern South Asia.<br><br>Thanks,<br>Divya Narayanan   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T15:45:27+05:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divya Narayanan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3e899928.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ba175ebf.1503">   <title>Looking for partners </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ba175ebf.1503</link>   <description> In the Univerdiad Francisco de Vitoria (Madrid, Spain) we are looking for partners to join us in a &quot;Uses of the Past&quot;project. We would like to study sources of thinking of European thinkers to reinterpret those texts in a proper way to help to rebuild a renewed &quot;paideia&quot; and making new materials for study to achieve a more comprehensive university education. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:04:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Felix Hap</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ba175ebf.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;da025631.1503">   <title>Only one more PI required! The Politics of Progress </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;da025631.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>We have three partners for a project broadly conceptualised as the<br>'politics of progress'. At the moment this project is divided into two<br>sub-projects on the politics of healthcare and the uses of progress and<br>time within political discourses. We would welcome a third 'strand' or<br>anybody who can fit within the existing two outlined briefly below.<br>Obviously we also need somebody from a fourth country (not UK, Latvia and<br>Portugal) as well - we look forward to hearing from you (please contact me<br>at victoria.bates@bristol.ac.uk)! [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T09:48:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>VL Bates</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;da025631.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;cbd43ac4.1503">   <title>Uses of the past </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;cbd43ac4.1503</link>   <description> Waiting for news about your project that interestsme.<br>gratefull<br>Maria Duarte (Portugal)   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T12:14:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Maria Jo\ufffd\ufffdo Raminhos Duarte</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;cbd43ac4.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;31861770.1503">   <title>Uses of the past call for collaboration </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;31861770.1503</link>   <description> HERA Uses of the Past<br>Priv. Doz. Dr. Norman Saadi Nikro<br>Research Fellow<br>Zentrum Moderner Orient, Berlin<br>saadi.norman@zmo.de<br><br>Cities United, Cities Divided: Between Past and Present<br>This research project focuses on a comparative investigation of historically divided cities, such as Berlin, Sarajevo, Beirut, Belfast, and Jerusalem. The overall research interest concerns the temporal and spatial tensions between the physicality of a city\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds division/unification and its imaginative sense of being divided or unified. Accordingly, a primary research question focusses on how memories and histories of past division and/or unification are put to use in present circumstances of division and/or unification.<br>Cities [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T11:09:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Norman Saadi Nikro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;31861770.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;45786db1.1503">   <title>Re: RETHINKING HOLY GROUND </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;45786db1.1503</link>   <description> Dear Christina,<br>my research is at the boundary between technology and social sciences. I was interested in your post. Are you still looking for partners? Perhaps we could exchange emails to discuss? You can find out more about my work here:<br>http://www.dundee.ac.uk/djcad/staff/wendymoncur/<br>and here http://discovery.dundee.ac.uk/portal/en/persons/wendy-moncur%28bcbb7879-4df7-427d-bd0f-08ccd5274ec7%29.html<br><br>Best wishes, Wendy Moncur<br>University of Dundee, Scotland.<br><br>email: wmoncur@dundee.ac.uk   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T10:14:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Wendy Moncur</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;45786db1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2577e77b.1503">   <title>Knowledge, Upgrading and Development of Old rural Settlements of the first half of the twentieth century\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (KUDOS)</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2577e77b.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are looking for partners to project: &quot;Knowledge, Upgrading and<br>Development of Old rural Settlements of the first half of the twentieth<br>century\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (KUDOS). I will happily answer all questions from any potentially<br>interested researchers.<br><br>I give you all the information summarized:<br><br>The research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdKnowledge, Upgrading and Development of Old rural Settlements<br>of the first half of the twentieth century\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (KUDOS) concerns with in<br>different ways all those European countries affected by the phenomenon of<br>the colonization of large estates typically forced by totalitarian regimes<br>(Italy, Croatia, Spain, Portugal, etc.). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T16:08:24+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tiziana Basirico</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;2577e77b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d4e4d5be.1503">   <title>Re: Toppled statues and 3D-models: Call for non-German partners </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d4e4d5be.1503</link>   <description> Dear Franziska and Ralf,<br>we are researcher in ENEA (the Italian National Agency for New Technologies, Energy and Sustainable Economic Development). ENEA conducts research and innovation activities also in the area of Cultural Heritage conservation.<br><br>The ICT Unit of ENEA has a long experience in the field of ICT technologies applied to Cultural Heritage for the preservation of material and immaterial Knowledge<br>http://patrimonioculturale.enea.it/ambiti-di-ricerca/information-and-communications-technology [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T12:09:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Luciana Bordoni</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d4e4d5be.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;74e2d611.1503">   <title>Cultural landscapes along the ancient roman roads </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;74e2d611.1503</link>   <description> ...lookinf for Slovenian researchers<br><br>We are a group from the University of RomaTre (Department of Architecture) interested in ancient roman roads through Europe. We would gather researchers in the aim of increasing the awareness of people living in territories that were connected by ancient roman networks.<br>Our attention is mainly paid to those territories that due to the dynamics of development are now in a particular situation, which have undergone a process of marginalization and now find themselves so far from the centers offering essential services but, at the same time, are rich with important environmental and cultural resources.<br>Recover [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T18:59:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Cristina Casadei</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;74e2d611.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ffe29428.1503">   <title>I am looking for three eligible Principal Investigators (PI) for my project... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ffe29428.1503</link>   <description> Dear colleagues, I am looking for three eligible Principal Investigators (PI) in order to apply for this HERA Joint Research Programme &quot;Uses of the Past&quot;. Alicia.<br><br>Application Template for a Project Idea to attend the Matchmaking Event on 29th January 2015 in Tallinn, Estonia<br>Name and Organisation of the Applicant: Alicia Marchant Rivera. Universidad de M\ufffd\ufffdlaga (Spain). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T14:12:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alicia Marchant Rivera</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;ffe29428.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3353e6db.1503">   <title>Historical rural landscapes as European heritage. Meanings, values, norms and policies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3353e6db.1503</link>   <description> We are looking for interested partners on the following proposal:<br><br>Historical rural landscapes are part of European cultural heritage and contribute to the common European identity.<br>This research aims to analyse and compare the processes in which they became or are becoming part of cultural heritage, throughout the XX-XXI century, in different European countries.<br>We focus on the definition given to historical rural landscapes, the values they encompass, who is responsible for their recognition and which is the best way to manage these landscapes in order to preserve and maintain these values.<br>VALUES. Different categories of values are involved, i.e. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T18:03:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Benedetta Castiglioni</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;3353e6db.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;4a764d63.1503">   <title>LATE ANTIQUITY </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;4a764d63.1503</link>   <description> PROF. MARISA SQUILLANTE, University of Naples Federico II, Italy<br><br>Looking for non-Italian partners. Areas of Interest: history, law, linguistic, history of religions, national literatures.<br>The topics: Use of the past in Late Antiquity; Identity and Otherness in Late Antiquity; Cultural Diversity in Late Antiquity; Late Antiquity as past to be 'used' by Europe. History, Historiography, Memory, and Identity in the Discourse of the 'Eurozone Crisis' since 2009-" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;c55e84dc.1503</link>   <description> Dear Peter Picher,<br><br>as I am an independent scholar and as such I am not legible for being PI at<br>HERA, but I would just like to draw your attention to a project on<br>smuggling economies uniting Europe whilst being divided throughout the XX<br>century (in national economies, but also by political systems, &quot;walls&quot; or<br>Iron Curtain), which might be useful in defining preEuropeannes. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T18:28:30+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ana Peraica</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;c55e84dc.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;50d85274.1503">   <title>Re: Searching PL and PIs "EUropean Uses of the Past? History, Historiography, Memory, and Identity in the Discourse of the 'Eurozone Crisis' since 2009-" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;50d85274.1503</link>   <description> Dear Peter Pichler,<br>I find your proposal very interesting and relevant and I think it would be great to have some collaboration with you on this topic. I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm a professor at the University of Minho, in Portugal, working specifically in the field of sociology of culture and cultural studies.<br>European identity is one of my main fields of research and, at the moment, I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm starting a research programme about transculturality and identity in Europe. Therefore, your ideas about the emotional radicalization regarding the European Union and Europeanness seem to me tremendously important in the context of Europe\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds unification crisis (which [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:14:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rita Ribeiro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;50d85274.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;bbc493e7.1503">   <title>Uses of the past in media-technological narratives (SMIT-VUB, Belgium) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;bbc493e7.1503</link>   <description> The introduction of media has always been accompanied by optimistic or pessimistics debates concerning their future societal impact. On a European scale, the study of such rhetorics is emerging, but has mainly been taken up within the geographical scope of nations states or is hardly comparative between a range of media. Sometimes there is also an imbalance in focus: optimistic or utopian visions are somehow getting more attention than dystopia or pessimistic visions or the visions pronounced by some actors (engineers, experts, institutions) are studied more than those emanating from more popular sources. Within the topic of this call, we [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T11:42:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shenja Van Der Graaf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;bbc493e7.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d88130d5.1503">   <title>Re: Impact of long-term archaeological research on local societies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d88130d5.1503</link>   <description> Dear Dr. Debowska-Ludwin,<br><br>Your e-mail has been forwarded to me by Prof. Valdis Seglins from the<br>University of Latvia.<br>I would like to offer my candidacy for the participation in your project.<br>The scope of my research activities so far concerned Pre-Dynastic and Old<br>Kingdom periods (mainly the questions of construction materials and<br>preservation of the sites), supported by 8 years long experience in<br>participation in the archaeological research in Saqqara.<br>I believe my participation in the project focusing on long-term<br>archaeological research and its impact on local societies would be useful,<br>since for several years I have been a [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T10:53:02+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Agnese Kukela</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HERA-USESOFTHEPAST;d88130d5.1503</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
